cards.name: Cackling Witch
cards.text: {X}{B}, {T}, Discard a card: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The touch of his madness can drive anyone into a killing frenzy.
cards.originalText: {X}{B}, {T}, Discard a card from your hand: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Cateran Brute
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Search your library for a Mercenary permanent card with converted mana cost 2 or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: The Cateran guild prefers to call them "public relations."

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText: {2}, {T}: Search your library for a Mercenary card with converted mana cost 2 or less and put that card into play. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Cateran Enforcer
cards.text:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
{4}, {T}: Search your library for a Mercenary permanent card with converted mana cost 4 or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText:
Cateran Enforcer can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and black creatures.
{4}, {T}: Search your library for a Mercenary card with converted mana cost 4 or less and put that card into play. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Cateran Kidnappers
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Search your library for a Mercenary permanent card with converted mana cost 3 or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: Recruits aren't always volunteers.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText: {3}, {T}: Search your library for a Mercenary card with converted mana cost 3 or less and put that card into play. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Cateran Overlord
cards.text:
Sacrifice a creature: Regenerate Cateran Overlord.
{6}, {T}: Search your library for a Mercenary permanent card with converted mana cost 6 or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText:
Sacrifice a creature: Regenerate Cateran Overlord.
{6}, {T}: Search your library for a Mercenary card with converted mana cost 6 or less and put that card into play. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Cateran Persuader
cards.text: {1}, {T}: Search your library for a Mercenary permanent card with converted mana cost 1 or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText: {1}, {T}: Search your library for a Mercenary card with converted mana cost 1 or less and put that card into play. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Cateran Slaver
cards.text:
Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
{5}, {T}: Search your library for a Mercenary permanent card with converted mana cost 5 or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText:
Swampwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls a swamp.)
{5}, {T}: Search your library for a Mercenary card with converted mana cost 5 or less and put that card into play. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Cateran Summons
cards.text: Search your library for a Mercenary card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: Even when recruitment is slow, the guild can always cook something up.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText: Search your library for a Mercenary card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Conspiracy
cards.text:
As Conspiracy enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.
Creatures you control are the chosen type. The same is true for creature spells you control and creature cards you own that aren't on the battlefield.

rulings.text: It does not replace any use of creature types in card text.
This can grant a creature type to animated lands and artifacts that would otherwise have no creature type.
"Legend" is no longer a creature type, and may not be chosen.
If you choose Wall, then your creatures can still attack because creature types don't confer abilities such as defender (any more than, say, choosing creature type Bird would confer flying).
Affected spells, cards, and creatures lose all of their other creature types.

Replacement effects that modify creatures of a certain type as they enter the battlefield will apply (or not apply) after you apply this effect. For example, if Warrior is the chosen creature type and you control Bramblewood Paragon, a Runeclaw Bear would enter the battlefield with an additional +1/+1 counter.

cards.originalText:
As Conspiracy comes into play, choose a creature type.
Creatures you control and creature cards in your graveyard, hand, and library are of the chosen type.

cards.name: Corrupt Official
cards.text:
{2}{B}: Regenerate Corrupt Official.
Whenever Corrupt Official becomes blocked, defending player discards a card at random.
cards.flavor: His favor comes at a high price.

rulings.text: It triggers only once even if blocked by more than one creature.

cards.originalText:
{2}{B}: Regenerate Corrupt Official.
Whenever Corrupt Official becomes blocked, defending player discards a card at random from his or her hand.

cards.name: Dark Ritual
cards.text: Add {B}{B}{B}.
cards.flavor:
"Eye of twilight, give us sight.
Take our offer, give us might.
Make our power tears of night."
cards.originalText: Add {B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Deathgazer
cards.text: Whenever Deathgazer blocks or becomes blocked by a nonblack creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.
cards.originalText: Whenever Deathgazer blocks or becomes blocked by a nonblack creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.

cards.name: Deepwood Ghoul
cards.text: Pay 2 life: Regenerate Deepwood Ghoul.
cards.flavor: They feed on the living to stay undead.
cards.originalText: Pay 2 life: Regenerate Deepwood Ghoul.

cards.name: Deepwood Legate
cards.text:
If an opponent controls a Forest and you control a Swamp, you may cast this spell without paying its mana cost.
{B}: Deepwood Legate gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
If an opponent controls a forest and you control a swamp, you may play Deepwood Legate without paying its mana cost.
{B}: Deepwood Legate gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Delraich
cards.text:
You may sacrifice three black creatures rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Trample
cards.flavor: It wears the souls of its victims like jewels on a chain.
cards.originalText:
Trample
You may sacrifice three black creatures instead of paying Delraich's mana cost.

cards.name: Enslaved Horror
cards.text: When Enslaved Horror enters the battlefield, each other player may return a creature card from their graveyard to the battlefield.
cards.originalText: When Enslaved Horror comes into play, each other player may return a creature card from his or her graveyard to play.

cards.name: Extortion
cards.text: Look at target player's hand and choose up to two cards from it. That player discards those cards.
cards.flavor: The enforcers make no effort to distinguish gold from flesh.
cards.originalText: Look at target player's hand and choose up to two cards from it. That player discards those cards.

cards.name: Forced March
cards.text: Destroy all creatures with converted mana cost X or less.
cards.flavor: The Caterans call it a screening process. The dead are in no condition to argue.
cards.originalText: Destroy all creatures with converted mana cost X or less.

cards.name: Ghoul's Feast
cards.text: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is the number of creature cards in your graveyard.
cards.flavor: Mercadians not wealthy enough to buy a tomb are thrown into a bog called "the Ghoul's Larder."
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is the number of creature cards in your graveyard.

cards.name: Haunted Crossroads
cards.text: {B}: Put target creature card from your graveyard on top of your library.
cards.flavor: It seemed as if no one wanted them to reach the Henge of Ramos—not even the dead.
cards.originalText: {B}: Put target creature card from your graveyard on top of your library.

cards.name: Highway Robber
cards.text: When Highway Robber enters the battlefield, target opponent loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.
cards.flavor: "Tonight, madam, it's your money and your life."
cards.originalText: When Highway Robber comes into play, you gain 2 life and target opponent loses 2 life.

cards.name: Instigator
cards.text: {1}{B}{B}, {T}, Discard a card: Creatures target player controls attack this turn if able.
cards.flavor: The desecration of their dead makes even the Saprazzans careless.

rulings.text: There is no penalty if the creatures are unable to attack.

cards.originalText: {1}{B}{B}, {T}, Discard a card from your hand: Creatures target player controls attack this turn if able.

cards.name: Insubordination
cards.text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of the end step of enchanted creature's controller, Insubordination deals 2 damage to that player unless that creature attacked this turn.
cards.originalText: At the end of the turn of enchanted creature's controller, Insubordination deals 2 damage to that player unless enchanted creature attacked this turn.

cards.name: Intimidation
cards.text: Creatures you control have fear. (They can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
cards.flavor: "If they move, kill them. In fact, kill one now to make sure the other understands."
cards.originalText: Creatures you control can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and black creatures.

cards.name: Larceny
cards.text: Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage to a player, that player discards a card.

rulings.text: Triggers once per creature, not once per point of damage.

cards.originalText: Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage to a player, that player discards a card from his or her hand.

cards.name: Liability
cards.text: Whenever a nontoken permanent is put into a player's graveyard from the battlefield, that player loses 1 life.
cards.flavor: Gerrard realized that the helpless woman they'd rescued from Rath was nothing of the sort.
cards.originalText: Whenever a card is put into a player's graveyard from play, that player loses 1 life.

cards.name: Maggot Therapy
cards.text:
Flash
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/-2.
cards.flavor:
"If this is the cure, I'd hate to see the disease."
—Orim
cards.originalText:
You may play Maggot Therapy any time you could play an instant.
Enchanted creature gets +2/-2.

cards.name: Midnight Ritual
cards.text: Exile X target creature cards from your graveyard. For each creature card exiled this way, create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.
cards.flavor: Bury old friends deeply, lest they return bearing worms.
cards.originalText: Remove X target creature cards in your graveyard from the game. For each creature card removed this way, put a black 2/2 Zombie creature token into play.

cards.name: Misshapen Fiend
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: You'd scarcely believe they could fly until they drop out of the sky onto you.
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Molting Harpy
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Molting Harpy unless you pay {2}.
cards.flavor: Shed harpy feathers leave painful wounds—which explains the harpies' mood.
cards.originalText:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Molting Harpy unless you pay {2}.

cards.name: Nether Spirit
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if Nether Spirit is the only creature card in your graveyard, you may return Nether Spirit to the battlefield.
cards.flavor: It roams in both the worlds of the living and the dead but belongs to neither.
cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, if Nether Spirit is the only creature card in your graveyard, you may return Nether Spirit to play.

cards.name: Notorious Assassin
cards.text: {2}{B}, {T}, Discard a card: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor: He wears his infamy like a fine silk shirt.
cards.originalText: {2}{B}, {T}, Discard a card from your hand: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Pretender's Claim
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature becomes blocked, tap all lands defending player controls.
cards.flavor: The surest way to lose your holdings is to plead for them in Mercadia City's courts.
cards.originalText: Whenever enchanted creature becomes blocked, tap all lands defending player controls.

cards.name: Primeval Shambler
cards.text: {B}: Primeval Shambler gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: His mind, like his body, is made up of the swamp's flotsam.
cards.originalText: {B}: Primeval Shambler gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Putrefaction
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a green or white spell, that player discards a card.
cards.flavor:
"Do you want to be alive or whole?"
—Ta-Karnst, Cho-Arrim healer
cards.originalText: Whenever a player plays a white spell or green spell, that player discards a card from his or her hand.

cards.name: Quagmire Lamprey
cards.text: Whenever Quagmire Lamprey becomes blocked by a creature, put a -1/-1 counter on that creature.
cards.originalText: Whenever Quagmire Lamprey becomes blocked by a creature, put a -1/-1 counter on that creature.

cards.name: Rain of Tears
cards.text: Destroy target land.
cards.flavor: Mercadian elitism is reinforced daily by physical position: their neighbors are literally beneath them and are treated accordingly.
cards.originalText: Destroy target land.

cards.name: Rampart Crawler
cards.text: Rampart Crawler can't be blocked by Walls.
cards.flavor:
"Not even the magistrate in his lofty tower is out of our reach."
—Cateran overlord
cards.originalText: Rampart Crawler can't be blocked by Walls.

cards.name: Rouse
cards.text:
If you control a Swamp, you may pay 2 life rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Target creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
If you control a swamp, you may pay 2 life instead of paying Rouse's mana cost.
Target creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Scandalmonger
cards.text: {2}: Target player discards a card. Any player may activate this ability but only any time they could cast a sorcery.
cards.flavor: Silence costs extra. Breaking it costs extra still.
cards.originalText: {2}: Target player discards a card from his or her hand. Any player may play this ability but only if he or she could play a sorcery.

cards.name: Sever Soul
cards.text: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated. You gain life equal to its toughness.
cards.flavor:
"With the proper tools, even the Great River can be dammed."
—Ta-Spon, Cho-Arrim executioner
cards.originalText: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated. You gain life equal to its toughness.

cards.name: Silent Assassin
cards.text: {3}{B}: Destroy target blocking creature at end of combat.
cards.flavor: She feels no need to disturb her victim's slumber.

rulings.text: If you activate the ability during the end of combat step, the creature will be destroyed at the beginning of the next end of combat step, even if that step occurs during a different turn.

cards.originalText: {3}{B}: Destroy target blocking creature at end of combat.

cards.name: Skulking Fugitive
cards.text: When Skulking Fugitive becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice it.
cards.flavor: In the Cateran guild, being caught is a capital offense.
cards.originalText: When Skulking Fugitive becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice Skulking Fugitive.

cards.name: Snuff Out
cards.text:
If you control a Swamp, you may pay 4 life rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor: Squee watched his Kyren cousins fall with a mixture of sympathy and relief.
cards.originalText:
If you control a swamp, you may pay 4 life instead of paying Snuff Out's mana cost.
Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Soul Channeling
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Pay 2 life: Regenerate enchanted creature.
cards.flavor: Driven by masters more terrible than the Mercadians could imagine, the dark overseers would pay any price to keep their shipwrights working.
cards.originalText: Pay 2 life: Regenerate enchanted creature.

cards.name: Specter's Wail
cards.text: Target player discards a card at random.
cards.flavor: As he gritted his teeth to focus through the pain, Tahngarth glanced at Takara. She seemed completely unaffected.
cards.originalText: Target player discards a card at random from his or her hand.

cards.name: Strongarm Thug
cards.text: When Strongarm Thug enters the battlefield, you may return target Mercenary card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: "No, I insist—let me carry all that heavy jewelry."
cards.originalText: When Strongarm Thug comes into play, you may return a Mercenary card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Thrashing Wumpus
cards.text: {B}: Thrashing Wumpus deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.
cards.flavor: Young wumpuses are malevolent and vicious—but they grow out of it.
cards.originalText: {B}: Thrashing Wumpus deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.

cards.name: Undertaker
cards.text: {B}, {T}, Discard a card: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: The weight of death is heavy but not immovable.
cards.originalText: {B}, {T}, Discard a card from your hand: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Unmask
cards.text:
You may exile a black card from your hand rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Target player reveals their hand. You choose a nonland card from it. That player discards that card.

rulings.text: If you target yourself with this spell, you must reveal your entire hand to the other players just as any other player would.

cards.originalText:
You may remove a black card in your hand from the game instead of paying Unmask's mana cost.
Look at target player's hand and choose a nonland card from it. That player discards that card.

cards.name: Unnatural Hunger
cards.text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, Unnatural Hunger deals damage equal to that creature's power to that player unless they sacrifice another creature.
cards.originalText: At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, Unnatural Hunger deals to that player damage equal to enchanted creature's power unless he or she sacrifices another creature.

cards.name: Vendetta
cards.text: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated. You lose life equal to that creature's toughness.
cards.flavor: Starke knew the voice was Takara's, but the venom was Volrath's.

rulings.text: If the targeted creature is an illegal target by the time Vendetta resolves, the spell doesn't resolve. You won't lose life.
The destroyed creature's last existence on the battlefield is checked to determine its toughness.

If the targeted creature isn't destroyed due to totem armor's effect, Vendetta continues to resolve. You lose life equal to the creature's current toughness (after the Aura with totem armor has been destroyed).

cards.originalText: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated. You lose life equal to that creature's toughness.

cards.name: Wall of Distortion
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{2}{B}, {T}: Target player discards a card. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
cards.flavor: It reflects only nightmares.
cards.originalText:
(Walls can't attack.)
{2}{B}, {T}: Target player discards a card from his or her hand. Play this ability only if you could play a sorcery.

cards.name: Arms Dealer
cards.text: {1}{R}, Sacrifice a Goblin: Arms Dealer deals 4 damage to target creature.
cards.flavor: He has the weapons, he has the connections, and he knows the hangar's dark secret.

rulings.text: You can sacrifice Arms Dealer to activate its own ability.

cards.originalText: {1}{R}, Sacrifice a Goblin: Arms Dealer deals 4 damage to target creature.

cards.name: Battle Rampart
cards.text:
Defender
{T}: Target creature gains haste until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
(Walls can't attack.)
{T}: Target creature gains haste until end of turn. (That creature may attack and {T} the turn it comes under your control.)

cards.name: Battle Squadron
cards.text:
Flying
Battle Squadron's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures you control.
cards.flavor: The goblins made an unruly pile with military precision.

rulings.text: Battle Squadron's last ability applies in all zones. While it's on the battlefield, it counts itself, so it'll be at least 1/1.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Battle Squadron's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures you control.

cards.name: Blaster Mage
cards.text: {R}, {T}, Discard a card: Destroy target Wall.
cards.flavor: "Don't get up. I'll show myself out."
cards.originalText: {R}, {T}, Discard a card from your hand: Destroy target Wall.

cards.name: Blood Hound
cards.text:
Whenever you're dealt damage, you may put that many +1/+1 counters on Blood Hound.
At the beginning of your end step, remove all +1/+1 counters from Blood Hound.
cards.originalText:
Whenever you're dealt damage, you may put that many +1/+1 counters on Blood Hound.
At the end of your turn, remove all +1/+1 counters from Blood Hound.

cards.name: Blood Oath
cards.text: Choose a card type. Target opponent reveals their hand. Blood Oath deals 3 damage to that player for each card of the chosen type revealed this way. (Artifact, creature, enchantment, instant, land, planeswalker, sorcery, and tribal are card types.)
cards.originalText: Choose a card type. Target opponent reveals his or her hand. Blood Oath deals 3 damage to that player for each card of the chosen type revealed this way. (The card types are artifact, creature, enchantment, instant, land, and sorcery.)

cards.name: Brawl
cards.text: Until end of turn, all creatures gain "{T}: This creature deals damage equal to its power to target creature."
cards.flavor: Anything can happen when patience is scarce and wine is abundant.
cards.originalText: Until end of turn, all creatures gain "{T}: This creature deals damage equal to its power to target creature."

cards.name: Cave Sense
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and has mountainwalk. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and has mountainwalk. (It's unblockable as long as defending player controls a mountain.)

cards.name: Cave-In
cards.text:
You may exile a red card from your hand rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Cave-In deals 2 damage to each creature and each player.
cards.flavor: One fleet was gone; others were poised.
cards.originalText:
You may remove a red card in your hand from the game instead of paying Cave-In's mana cost.
Cave-In deals 2 damage to each creature and each player.

cards.name: Cavern Crawler
cards.text:
Mountainwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
{R}: Cavern Crawler gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
Mountainwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls a mountain.)
{R}: Cavern Crawler gets +1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Ceremonial Guard
cards.text: When Ceremonial Guard attacks or blocks, destroy it at end of combat.
cards.flavor:
"These guards are the most disciplined military unit in the city. They couldn't fight their way out of a broom closet, but they've got discipline."
—Gerrard, to Sisay
cards.originalText: When Ceremonial Guard attacks or blocks, destroy it at end of combat.

cards.name: Cinder Elemental
cards.text: {X}{R}, {T}, Sacrifice Cinder Elemental: Cinder Elemental deals X damage to any target.
cards.flavor: Their rage can grow to such proportions that they explode in a cloud of fire.
cards.originalText: {X}{R}, {T}, Sacrifice Cinder Elemental: Cinder Elemental deals X damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Close Quarters
cards.text: Whenever a creature you control becomes blocked, Close Quarters deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: The Mercadians' ineptitude in close combat sometimes accidentally pays off.
cards.originalText: Whenever a creature you control becomes blocked, Close Quarters deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Crag Saurian
cards.text: Whenever a source deals damage to Crag Saurian, that source's controller gains control of Crag Saurian.
cards.flavor: It follows the strongest leader—the one with the longest whip.
cards.originalText: Whenever Crag Saurian is dealt damage, the controller of that damage's source gains control of Crag Saurian.

cards.name: Crash
cards.text:
You may sacrifice a Mountain rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Destroy target artifact.
cards.flavor: Gerrard shook his head as the ground rushed to meet him. "This," he thought, "is not the start I was hoping for."
cards.originalText:
You may sacrifice a mountain instead of paying Crash's mana cost.
Destroy target artifact.

cards.name: Flailing Manticore
cards.text:
Flying, first strike
{1}: Flailing Manticore gets +1/+1 until end of turn. Any player may activate this ability.
{1}: Flailing Manticore gets -1/-1 until end of turn. Any player may activate this ability.
cards.originalText:
Flying, first strike
{1}: Flailing Manticore gets +1/+1 until end of turn. Any player may play this ability.
{1}: Flailing Manticore gets -1/-1 until end of turn. Any player may play this ability.

cards.name: Flailing Ogre
cards.text:
{1}: Flailing Ogre gets +1/+1 until end of turn. Any player may activate this ability.
{1}: Flailing Ogre gets -1/-1 until end of turn. Any player may activate this ability.
cards.originalText:
{1}: Flailing Ogre gets +1/+1 until end of turn. Any player may play this ability.
{1}: Flailing Ogre gets -1/-1 until end of turn. Any player may play this ability.

cards.name: Flailing Soldier
cards.text:
{1}: Flailing Soldier gets +1/+1 until end of turn. Any player may activate this ability.
{1}: Flailing Soldier gets -1/-1 until end of turn. Any player may activate this ability.
cards.originalText:
{1}: Flailing Soldier gets +1/+1 until end of turn. Any player may play this ability.
{1}: Flailing Soldier gets -1/-1 until end of turn. Any player may play this ability.

cards.name: Flaming Sword
cards.text:
Flash
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 and has first strike.
cards.flavor:
"It's not Talruum crystal, but I must admit—it gets the job done."
—Tahngarth
cards.originalText:
You may play Flaming Sword any time you could play an instant.
Target creature gets +1/+0 and has first strike.

cards.name: Furious Assault
cards.text: Whenever you cast a creature spell, Furious Assault deals 1 damage to target player or planeswalker.
cards.flavor:
"Does it burn, Saprazzan? Do you wish you had never raised arms against us?"
—Kyren overseer

rulings.text: You can choose a different target player or planeswalker each time this triggers.

cards.originalText: Whenever you play a creature spell, Furious Assault deals 1 damage to target player.

cards.name: Gerrard's Irregulars
cards.text: Trample, haste
cards.flavor: Had Gerrard realized he'd end up fighting against them, he might not have trained them so well.
cards.originalText: Trample; haste (This creature may attack and {T} the turn it comes under your control.)

cards.name: Hammer Mage
cards.text: {X}{R}, {T}, Discard a card: Destroy all artifacts with converted mana cost X or less.
cards.flavor: When he's holding the hammers, everything looks like a nail.
cards.originalText: {X}{R}, {T}, Discard a card from your hand: Destroy all artifacts with converted mana cost X or less.

cards.name: Hired Giant
cards.text: When Hired Giant enters the battlefield, each other player may search their library for a land card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then each player who searched their library this way shuffles it.
cards.originalText: When Hired Giant comes into play, each other player may search his or her library for a land card, put that card into play, then shuffle that library.

cards.name: Kris Mage
cards.text: {R}, {T}, Discard a card: Kris Mage deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: Her blade draws blood without ever touching its target.
cards.originalText: {R}, {T}, Discard a card from your hand: Kris Mage deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Kyren Glider
cards.text:
Flying
Kyren Glider can't block.
cards.flavor: Mercadia's Kyren goblins are the opposite of Dominarian goblins: they're smart and cowardly.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Kyren Glider can't block.

cards.name: Kyren Legate
cards.text:
If an opponent controls a Plains and you control a Mountain, you may cast this spell without paying its mana cost.
Haste
cards.originalText:
If an opponent controls a plains and you control a mountain, you may play Kyren Legate without paying its mana cost.
Haste (This creature may attack and {T} the turn it comes under your control.)

cards.name: Kyren Negotiations
cards.text: Tap an untapped creature you control: Kyren Negotiations deals 1 damage to target player or planeswalker.
cards.flavor: Kyren goblins always speak in questions and never allow wrong answers.
cards.originalText: Tap an untapped creature you control: Kyren Negotiations deals 1 damage to target player.

cards.name: Kyren Sniper
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may have Kyren Sniper deal 1 damage to target player or planeswalker.
cards.flavor: Kyren goblins always act behind the scenes—even in battle.
cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may have Kyren Sniper deal 1 damage to target player.

cards.name: Lava Runner
cards.text:
Haste
Whenever Lava Runner becomes the target of a spell or ability, that spell or ability's controller sacrifices a land.
cards.originalText:
Haste (This creature may attack and {T} the turn it comes under your control.)
Whenever Lava Runner becomes the target of a spell or ability, that spell or ability's controller sacrifices a land.

cards.name: Lightning Hounds
cards.text: First strike
cards.flavor: Quick enough to avoid jhovalls when alone and fierce enough to attack them in packs, the hounds were as at home in the mountains as the Mercadians were atop theirs.
cards.originalText: First strike

cards.name: Lithophage
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Lithophage unless you sacrifice a Mountain.
cards.flavor: It's viciously territorial, destroying every creature on the mountain it has chosen to consume.
cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Lithophage unless you sacrifice a mountain.

cards.name: Lunge
cards.text: Lunge deals 2 damage to target creature and 2 damage to target player or planeswalker.
cards.flavor: Cho-Arrim righteousness was no match for Benalish combat training.
cards.originalText: Lunge deals 2 damage to target creature and 2 damage to target player.

cards.name: Magistrate's Veto
cards.text: White creatures and blue creatures can't block.
cards.flavor: The magistrate had been the goblins' puppet for so long that he made the right decisions with little prompting.
cards.originalText: White creatures and blue creatures can't block.

cards.name: Mercadia's Downfall
cards.text: Each attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn for each nonbasic land defending player controls.
cards.flavor: With an explosion that shook the foundation of the city, the Weatherlight burst from the underground hangar.

rulings.text: The creatures that are attacking is determined when this resolves and is not changed later, even if you have another combat phase.

cards.originalText: Attacking creatures get +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is the number of nonbasic lands defending player controls.

cards.name: Ogre Taskmaster
cards.text: Ogre Taskmaster can't block.
cards.flavor: He doesn't have to be smart—his masters only ever give him one command.
cards.originalText: Ogre Taskmaster can't block.

cards.name: Pulverize
cards.text:
You may sacrifice two Mountains rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Destroy all artifacts.
cards.originalText:
You may sacrifice two mountains instead of paying Pulverize's mana cost.
Destroy all artifacts.

cards.name: Puppet's Verdict
cards.text: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, destroy all creatures with power 2 or less. If you lose the flip, destroy all creatures with power 3 or greater.
cards.flavor:
"What was heads again?"
—Mercadian magistrate
cards.originalText: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, destroy all creatures with power 2 or less. If you lose the flip, destroy all creatures with power 3 or greater.

cards.name: Robber Fly
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Robber Fly becomes blocked, defending player discards all the cards in their hand, then draws that many cards.
cards.flavor: In pursuit of the juicy fly, Squee stumbled on the hidden hangar.

rulings.text: It triggers only once even if blocked by more than one creature.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Robber Fly becomes blocked, defending player discards his or her hand, then draws that many cards.

cards.name: Rock Badger
cards.text: Mountainwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
cards.flavor: The Kyren goblins created most of the inverted mountain's tunnels simply by driving the beast before them.
cards.originalText: Mountainwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls a mountain.)

cards.name: Seismic Mage
cards.text: {2}{R}, {T}, Discard a card: Destroy target land.
cards.flavor: The ground shakes when he walks. His customers shake if they're late with his fee.
cards.originalText: {2}{R}, {T}, Discard a card from your hand: Destroy target land.

cards.name: Shock Troops
cards.text: Sacrifice Shock Troops: It deals 2 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: When goblins blow themselves up, it's called stupidity. When humans do, it's called heroism.
cards.originalText: Sacrifice Shock Troops: Shock Troops deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Sizzle
cards.text: Sizzle deals 3 damage to each opponent.
cards.flavor: Explosions ripped through the ship overhead, and those unfortunate enough to be directly below scrambled to find cover.
cards.originalText: Sizzle deals 3 damage to each opponent.

cards.name: Squee, Goblin Nabob
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may return Squee, Goblin Nabob from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: "General?!" Tahngarth roared. "General nuisance, maybe."

rulings.text: Squee's ability triggers only if it's in your graveyard as your upkeep begins.

cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, if Squee, Goblin Nabob is in your graveyard, you may return Squee to your hand.

cards.name: Stone Rain
cards.text: Destroy target land.
cards.flavor: The return of Ramos was foretold by devastating natural disasters and unnatural storms.
cards.originalText: Destroy target land.

cards.name: Tectonic Break
cards.text: Each player sacrifices X lands.
cards.flavor: Only the foolish and the rich build their houses where the land is thin and the ocean is near.
cards.originalText: Each player sacrifices X lands.

cards.name: Territorial Dispute
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Territorial Dispute unless you sacrifice a land.
Players can't play lands.
cards.flavor: Bit by bit, Mercadia City had forced the Cho-Arrim from their ancestral lands. They would be pushed no further.

rulings.text: Does not stop lands from being put onto the battlefield by a spell or ability. It only stops players from taking the action of playing a land.

cards.originalText:
Players can't play lands.
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Territorial Dispute unless you sacrifice a land.

cards.name: Thieves' Auction
cards.text: Exile all nontoken permanents. Starting with you, each player chooses one of the exiled cards and puts it onto the battlefield tapped under their control. Repeat this process until all cards exiled this way have been chosen.

rulings.text: In multi-player games, it affects all players and players make choices in turn order.
An Aura put onto the battlefield this way does not target the permanent it is placed upon.
Triggers from the permanents leaving the battlefield and then being put back onto the battlefield are not put on the stack until the entire effect is done.
You can't pick a card that can't legally be returned to the battlefield. If there are no cards that can be legally returned, then you can't pick one.

If you choose an Aura, you can put it on any permanent it can legally enchant. If there is nothing it can legally enchant, it remains exiled, and it can still be chosen by you or another player later in the auction. If there comes a point where only Auras and no legal permanents left, they stay exiled permanently.

cards.originalText: Set aside all permanents. You choose one of those cards and put it into play tapped under your control. Then your opponent chooses one and puts it into play tapped under his or her control. Repeat this process until all cards set aside this way have been chosen. (Local enchantments with no permanent to enchant remain removed from the game.)
